attributes.action: Call for UN peacekeepers and humanitarian access infrastructure in Gaza.
attributes.additional_details: Gaza faces famine, mass displacement, and collapsed health systems. Over 60,000 civilians have died. The UK, given its historic role, should partner with a Middle East country to table a UN resolution for peacekeepers and a UN-managed airstrip and port to ensure safe aid access and support the reconstruction of infrastructure such as  schools, hospitals, sustainable housing, water treatment stations and some sort of leisure facilities. Please
attributes.background: We ask The UK to work with a Middle East partner to request UN peacekeepers in Gaza and support a UN-managed temporary airstrip and port to ensure safe humanitarian access, protect civilians, restore essential services, and enable long-term recovery and reconstruction.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/728104
